author: ryg9705
content: I have implemented a minimal libp2p library in Elixir and have an Elixir client that is passing all the spec tests up to Fulu. When I initialize my discv5 discovery with the mainnet bootnode ENRs and start to maintain a peerstore. I connect to 150 peers but from the Status messages almost everyone is on fork_digest ad532ceb but given the Fulu Fork Version and Genesis Validator Root of mainnet shouldn't the majority of peers advertise 82fae541? Hence, I'm dropping them and not syncing. Anyone has an idea what I might be missing.

author: leobago
content:
`ad532ceb` => Electra fork digest
`82fae541` => Fulu fork digest (Before BPOs)
`cb0d1acc` => Fulu BPO1 fork digest
After Fulu, you need to apply a XOR mask with the hash of the BPO parameters in order to get the fork digest. You can find more details here: https://ethereum.github.io/consensus-specs/specs/fulu/beacon-chain/#modified-compute_fork_digest
